snippet: Analysts say the collective decline of several current and former female leaders in South America points to a persistence of macho attitudes in the region.
abstract: Gender scholars analyze plight of three powerful women embroiled in South American politics and are unable to coalesce behind single factor that caused precipitous drop in approval ratings; analysts do agree that persistence of macho attitudes in region, especially within the political establishment, have contributed to political struggles faced by former Pres of Argentina Cristina Fernandez de Kirchner, Pres of Brazil Dilma Rousseff and Pres Michelle Bachelet of Chile.
lead_paragraph: Analysts say the collective decline of several current and former female leaders in South America points to a persistence of macho attitudes in the region.

headline.main: South America’s Powerful Women Are Embattled. Is Gender a Factor?
headline.print_headline: As South America’s Powerful Women  Struggle, Gender’s Part Is Pondered
